Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a means to control free thinkers and silence differing opinions.
The government is perceived as being influenced by international organizations like the UN, WHO, WEF, and GAVI.
The submission suggests that the legislation is part of a larger agenda to control narratives on global issues such as climate change, health strategies, and digital identity.
There is a belief that the legislation will lead to censorship and the erosion of democratic rights, particularly free speech.
The submission criticizes the government's handling of COVID-19, suggesting misinformation came from official sources.
Notable Quotes: Is the government so panicked by the thought that they cannot control the minds and actions of those free thinkers that they must resort to silencing those who have a logical, sensible, yet differing opinion to their own?
Truth determination and management by ACMA is an insult to our intelligence as a race.
If this legislation is passed and implemented, we edge closer to the end of our democratic right to free speech.
